Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just for underwater use, I wasnt expecting much from it because of how cheap the price is but wow it did not disappoint! It takes wonderful, clear under water portraits and even videos. I also took some pictures outside of the water and I was impressed. It is such a nice camera to have and not have to worry about getting it wet. I highly recommend this camera for those who want a waterproof camera and do not want to spend much for it.

Reviews.Title: Leaked after two uses
Reviews.Author: beachfl
Reviews.Content: The camera took decent pictures, but it leaked after only using it for the second time.  The first time I got great pictures of a coral reef.  The second time I was just standing in the surf with my family taking pictures and it stopped working after about 5 minutes and 10 pictures.  very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera I've Ever (briefly) Owned
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: It pays to be educated and look at the specs before you buy a camera. I picked this turd based on the fact that it is waterproof, 10mp, 3x Optical, has image stabilization, and only $49 at Wal-mart. Here is everything wrong with it:NOISEThis camera has the nosiest sensor I've ever used, and that includes bottom of the line Sanyo's. Laughably the camera gives the option of selecting up to 1600 ISO when 100 is barely acceptable for 4x6 prints. Don't expect to get anything larger out of this camera under any circumstances. This brings me to:IMAGE STABILIZATIONThis camera lists this as a feature on the box, what it really is doing is boosting the ISO in this mode so that the slow aperture lens has a fast enough shutter speed to eliminate camera shake. Never mind that ANY ISO over 100 produces an unacceptable amount of noise. Kudos to Olympus for giving me the choice of either a blurry picture or a speckled one.FLASHUsing a flash is not my preferred method of taking pictures, but this camera has especially poor results. There appears to be no compensation for distance and although there is a pre-flash I do not think the camera does any metering. The result is comparable to my LSI Diana, and that is not a compliment. Portraits are typically overexposed with dark backgrounds, or underexposed with blown out foregrounds.FOCUS/ZOOMSlow, slow, slow. SLOW.CONTINUOUS SHOOTINGYeah right. I checked with a watch, this camera takes 5 seconds, FIVE, to clear the buffer for the next shot. Then it helpfully displays the poor quality image you just took for an additional 2-3 seconds.MOVIE MODEI started to wonder if Olympus was just trolling consumers with this, 640x480 with massive grain. 1995 wants its webcam back.MY CONCLUSIONThe Kodak Playsport ZX3 this was purchased to compliment takes better pictures in every way. The Playsport is a cheap underwater camcorder. The problem is probably really the lens with this camera. The widest aperture available is 3.7, nearly a full stop slower than the Playsport's 2.8. Small format point and shoot digital cameras are handicapped in so many ways that a slow lens is basically a guarantee for poor image quality. If you need an underwater camera for a vacation buy a Kodak disposable over this.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera for it's price.
Reviews.Author: Fong
Reviews.Content: Pros:It does come with a micro-SD reader.Lightweight.Cheap.Small, Internal memory.Cons:The interface is a bit sluggish.The zoom is a bit slow.Buttons feel cheap, but I suppose thats because they're waterproof.Microphone, but NO speaker for in-camera playback.Screen is mediocre.Proprietary USB/video-out cord.Slightly slow recovery between pictures, but manageable.

Reviews.Title: Great all around Camera
Reviews.Author: George K. Dukes, III
Reviews.Content: I like having a camera to carry in the car for those unexpected times where I want 'more' than a cell phone pic.  My last Olympus had served me well for many a year and finally quit working after 1,000's of pics.  I was able to get a deal on this one at the dreaded WalMart because a lower priced Olympus was out of stock.  I have thoroughly enjoyed the camera.  This is a great camera for shallow water usage, and I've taken great pics underwater and while I was in the pool.  It's great to be able to take the camera in with me, as I just put it in the pocket of my swim trunks.  I would recommend this camera to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Great Waterproof/Underwater Camera!
Reviews.Author: Dina A. Martin "damartin13"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera!  My 14 year old son purchased it with his own money and he couldn't be happier.  It takes great pictures and videos AND best of all...he can get it wet!  It has spent many hours underwater and it still works just like new.  No leaks or cheesy "waterproof cases", this camera is really waterproof.  Finally someone made an inexpensive, waterproof camera that works great and is able take on 14 year old boys AND water!

Reviews.Title: worst digital camera i've ever had
Reviews.Author: nicole
Reviews.Content: i have had numerous digital cameras over the past 10 years. My last 3 being Olympus, which I've always had luck with...until I got this camera. I have always had cameras that I keep on the Auto flash/focus setting and get great pictures. I have had the camera for 6 months and cannot figure out how to get good, quality pictures. They are blurry, grainy, or very dark. I have contacted Olympus for help and have been told I need to adjust settings on the camera depending on the circumstances and couldn't get an answer on what the auto setting 'point and shoot' is for the camera. The Olympus rep was too technical and left me nothing but frustrated.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it
Reviews.Author: JNO
Reviews.Content: Used it twice.  It got wet the 2nd time and never worked again.  Seals don't seem to close properly after removing battery and memory card.  Battery compartment filled with water.It Stinks.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: crazy girl
Reviews.Content: perfect camera for kids to learn photography, being waterproof definite plus. Very durable, and kid friendly, easy to use and an excellent learning tool

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!
Reviews.Author: Angela C. Jessell
Reviews.Content: This item was returned after only 4 days.  If you are buying this camera for a child (under 6) it is a great gift.  The quality of pictures it takes is not worth the time for an adult.

Reviews.Title: UGH!!
Reviews.Author: victoryrider
Reviews.Content: Ihad a wp Olympus and lost it in a river. I thought I got the same kind and was sadly mistaken. Poor picture quality. I have to change the setting over and over again to get a decent clear picture with true color. I will try a higher quality Olympus due to the reliability of not leaking. I have dropped the x-560 several times and taken it in water swimming with no problem. But I would like more crisp pictures. not pictures with a yellowish hue.

Reviews.Title: Ruined our vacation, twice
Reviews.Author: W. Dean "VW Lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I love to snorkel and wanted to share pictures and video of what I've seen. It worked amazing on our first trip but on our second trip some water got in and the camera shut down. I dried it out and somehow it started working again. So before we went away I checked, cleaned and lubed all of the seals but once again the water got in and the camera is done. Don't buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Would not have bought it I could have tried it first.
Reviews.Author: Junkbondman
Reviews.Content: Poor quality auto focus. Requires very bright light to function. In indoor setting it was only able to focus on my dogs about a third of the time. Fluorescent overhead lighting. Not a problem with my prior Olympus 1050w which died on me recently nor any of my Sony or Nikon DSLRs. This was a budget replacement for occasional use and as a backup camera. Unreliable for use. Not quite a piece of junk but nearly so. Olympus X-560WP - Digital camera - compact - 10.0 Mpix - optical zoom: 3 x - supported memory: xD, microSD - greenThis review is for the product not the seller.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed!
Reviews.Author: Roy Mccullough "rdmj69"
Reviews.Content: I have been very pleased with the purchase of the Olympus X-560WP.  It takes great pictures for a digital camera that cost less than $100.00!

Reviews.Title: Great deal and Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "babyzsaab"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for my daughters for Christmas.  How perfect that we were already familiar with this camera as a friend had it and we knew how to work it right away.  So far so good!

Reviews.Title: My First Olympus Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Brinkley
Reviews.Content: I bought this in red, today, from Walmart for $49.00.  That's Right!!! $49.00 plus tax.  Beware, you need to buy your own XD card.  I had a Fuji camera that took an XD card, so I was ok.  It's not the best camera but it's not any worse than a lot of them that you pay a lot more for.  Haven't tried the movie mode.  Pic quality is ok.  Not tor replace a DSLR....It's just a fun camera.  I plan to take it in the shower and try it in the water..no nude pics of me..sorry.  Hmmm. I wonder...never mind.My husband was ok with it.  I was surprised.  I already own about 10 or more digital and film cameras.  Yeah..I am coo coo for cameras.Well.  It's ok for fifty bucks....wouldn't pay top dollar for it!go to your local Walmart now..check it out.  OR go on line to Walmart..no..online was not 49.00.  It is in the store.  I bought mine on a whim.

ProductInfo.Features:
3m waterproof, 10-megapixel, 3x optical zoom camera is so compact you can take it with you
The camera will be able to automatically choose from the 18 scene modes available
Use Perfect Fix to lighten up shadows and remove red-eye so a less-than-perfect shot can still turn out perfect
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus X-560WP - Digital camera - compact - 10.0 Mpix - optical zoom: 3 x - supported memory: xD, microSD - green
